page.title: 16LEISURE.
page.content: There are a number of established clubs and organisations in both Harlestone and Church Brampton catering for all ages and interests.Both Church Brampton and Harlestone have Historical Associations. The activities of most of these clubs are publicised in the free newsletter produced by the church and on notice boards in the villages. Harlestone's Institute,opened in 1924 is in Upper Harlestone and used mainly by that village. Harlestone Cricket Club uses the pavilion and playing fields beside the childrens area which was donated by Earl Spencer.The Playing Fields Association in Harlestone is made up of representatives of various groups. The Pytchley Hunt meets each Boxing Day at Althorp and at other times. A small caravan site exists in Harlestone.
